title: Get Started with Blogging
text:
This is an example post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!
It has a an image included, which will be the thumbnail in the overview. Without an image in the YAML header the first image of the blog post would be used.
This post is stored as a draft (draft: true) which results in the post not be included in the listing, site map, or site search.
To publish the post when it is complete, change the value for draft to draft: true and then render it.
Add a citation (Knuth 1984).




References

Knuth, D. E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” The Computer Journal 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: Hello, Penguins!
text:
Data
For this analysis we’ll use the penguins dataset from the palmerpenguins R package.

library(tidyverse)
library(ggthemes)
library(palmerpenguins)
library(gt)

title: Hello, Penguins!
text:
Species
The figure below is a scatterplot of species of penguins.


ggplot(penguins,
       aes(x = bill_length_mm, 
           y = bill_depth_mm,
           color = species,
           shape = species)) +
  geom_point() +
  scale_color_colorblind() +
  labs(x = "Bill length (mm)", y = "Bill depth (mm)") +
  theme_minimal()

title: Hello, Penguins!
text:
Penguins
The table below shows the first 10 penguins from the dataset.

penguins |>
  slice_head(n = 10) |>
  select(species, island, bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm) |>
  gt()

title: Hello, Penguins!
text:
Bibliography

Add exported .bib file to root folder (project)
Add YAML key and value: bibliography: "../../GH-USERNAME.bib"
Cite Knuth (1984) in-text
Add References Section as the final slide
